boat.name: Dz

owners.note: First and only owner from build to 2014.
owners.text: First and only owner from build to

boat.full_description:
Designed by Francois Vivier and built by John Moody of Traditional Sail, Salcome, 1994, ‘Dz’ is an ‘Aber’ class with dipping lug sail.

She accommodates two crew and may be trailed. Her hull is 14mm strip plank cedar, bronze edge-nailed, with finished exterior in Epiphanes black, carved sheerline and name in white. Her stem, keel, transom, thwarts and gunn’l are mahogany; ribs copper rove oak all finished brightwork. Spars are Douglas fir, all fittings bronze.
boat.short_description: Francois Vivier designed "Aber".  High quality vessel kept in show condition. Built for Charles Payton to celebrate his involvement in the Brest and Douarnenez Festivals from 1988.
